data.title: Result of Requisitioned General Meeting
data.full_content:
10 Jan 2024 11:47
RNS Number : 2749Z
Reabold Resources PLC
10 January 2024
10 January 2024
Reabold Resources plc
("Reabold" or the "Company")
Result of Requisitioned General Meeting
Reabold Resources plc, the oil & gas investing company with a diversified portfolio of exploration, appraisal and development projects, announces that, further to its announcement on 13 December 2023, all the proposed resolutions put to shareholders at the General Meeting by the Requisitioning Shareholders, including removing the entire Board of directors and replacing it with four new directors, were not passed.
Jeremy Edelman, Non-Executive Chairman of Reabold, said:
"Today's requisitioned General Meeting result represents the resounding support for the existing Board of Directors by its shareholders. The results represent an even greater margin of votes against the Requisitioning Shareholders' resolutions than was the case at the last requisitioned general meeting in November 2022. The Requisitioning Shareholders, who own approximately 7.91% of the Company's currently issued share capital, received average support for the proposed resolutions from shareholders representing approximately a further 5.77% of the Company's issued share capital. I would like to thank our shareholders for their support of the Board.
"This process has, once again, been a serious and costly distraction for Reabold, significantly delaying the management team's ability to execute the Company's strategy. The Board believes the Company is well positioned with its portfolio of strategic gas assets and strong cash position. The Company's efforts can now be entirely directed towards unlocking this value for all shareholders."

data.title: Update re Requisitioned General Meeting
data.full_content:
4 Jan 2024 15:40
RNS Number : 7051Y
Reabold Resources PLC
04 January 2024
4 January 2024
Reabold Resources plc
("Reabold" or the "Company")
Update re Requisitioned General Meeting
Further to the Company's announcement of 28 December 2023, Reabold has been informed by its Nominated Adviser, Strand Hanson Limited ("Strand Hanson"), that despite its best endeavours (which commenced on 29 November 2023) Strand Hanson has not received sufficient information to satisfy itself as to the suitability of the proposed directors to be directors of the Company. It has also not received sufficient, detailed explanations which address matters of concern which, in the case of certain of the proposed directors, arose from the due diligence that was able to be undertaken and interaction with the individuals concerned.
Accordingly, as set out in the Company's announcement of 28 December 2023 and in the circular sent to shareholders on 13 December 2023,
in the event that the resolutions in respect of the appointments of the proposed directors are passed, Strand Hanson has informed Reabold that it expects that it would be required to resign from its role as the Company's Nominated Adviser with immediate effect. Should this be required, in
accordance with AIM Rule 1, trading in the Company's ordinary shares on AIM would be suspended following the closing of the General Meeting on Wednesday, 10 January 2024. If a replacement Nominated Adviser is not appointed within one month, admission of the Company's securities to trading on AIM would be cancelled.
Ends

Reabold Resources PLC
29 December 2023
29 December 2023
Reabold Resources plc
("
Reabold
" or the "
Company
")
Glass Lewis Recommends Shareholders Support the Board's Recommendation to Vote Against All Resolutions
Reabold,
the oil & gas investing company with a diversified portfolio of exploration, appraisal and development projects,
is pleased to provide the following update on the Glass Lewis Proxy Paper report, as it relates to the Company's requisitioned general meeting to be held on 10 January 2024. Glass Lewis has recommended that shareholders VOTE AGAINST ALL proposed resolutions, consistent with the current Board's recommendation.
The current Board would encourage shareholders to cast their vote at their earliest convenience to ensure their votes are received before the general meeting.
Sachin Oza
, Co-CEO of Reabold, commented:
"We are pleased to note that the Glass Lewis Proxy Paper report, along with the ISS Proxy report, recommends that shareholders vote AGAINST ALL resolutions, consistent with the current Board's recommendation. We strongly encourage all shareholders to vote at their earliest convenience."
Ends

data.author: Laura2022
data.content: Big Tech firms are requesting hundreds of gigawatts of power demand from data centers to connect to the U.S. grids. But aging grid infrastructure in key regional markets and grid investments lagging behind the soaring demand are forcing grid operators to offer some alternative options to the hyperscalers looking to hook up their proposed data centers to the grids. One is "bring your own generation"-a trend that's expected to rise in the coming years. In many areas, grid operators are telling Big Tech to plan their data centers together with a power source to serve the facility's electricity demand.

data.author: Buffin
data.content: "In this video, Stephen Williams, Co-CEO, outlines the company's differentiated portfolio approach to pre-cash flow energy assets, focusing on identifying opportunities that are mispriced and applying technical and commercial expertise to unlock value efficiently. Stephen covers how Reabold has successfully executed this strategy in the past, including the Victory gas project, where a modest initial investment was ultimately sold to Shell for £32 million. The team also explains its deliberate focus on European gas assets, highlighting the backdrop of declining indigenous supply alongside resilient demand across the region. The latter part of the discussion introduces West Newton, one of the largest onshore gas discoveries in the UK and Western Europe, with an estimated 200 bcf resource. Reabold sets out the investment case, the scale of the opportunity, and the range of exit options available, from a potential sale through to self-development, offering greater strategic optionality than previous projects." https://reabold.com/activity-updates/rvQage-business-overview

data.content: Wonder Valley is Kevin O’Leary’s audacious bet on AI infrastructure — a 7.5GW off‑grid data‑center megapark in Alberta, built on stranded natural gas and geothermal power. Positioned above massive gas reserves, it aims to deliver low‑cost, high‑density compute for hyperscalers. If it lands, it could reshape the economics of AI compute. If it stumbles, it’s a $70B moonshot.

data.author: itsawrap
data.content: I dropped the decree into chatgpt for a translation... DECREE Project: SMALL SCALE LNG PLANT – Colle Santo Gas Field Proponent: LNEnergy S.r.l. Type: Environmental Compatibility Assessment (ECA) Article 1 – Environmental Compatibility Assessment Positive environmental compatibility is granted for the project “SMALL SCALE LNG PLANT – Colle Santo Gas Field” (onshore liquid and gaseous hydrocarbons), including: A favorable opinion regarding no significant negative impact on Natura 2000 sites, based on a Level II impact assessment. A favorable opinion on the Preliminary Plan for the use of excavated soil and rocks, as required by Article 24(3) of DPR 120/2017. These approvals are subject to compliance with environmental conditions set out in Articles 2 and 3. The decree includes landscape authorization under Article 146 of Legislative Decree 42/2004, as referenced in Article 25(2-quinquies) of Legislative Decree 152/2006, subject to the conditions 1 (1.1–1.4) and 2 in the Ministry of Culture opinion (prot. n. 31042, 18/11/2025). Validity: The decree is effective for five years from the date of publication on the Ministry of Environment and Energy Security website. After this period, a new environmental impact assessment must be carried out, unless an extension is requested. Article 2 – Environmental Conditions from PNRR-PNIEC Commission The proponent must comply with the environmental conditions in the PNRR-PNIEC Commission opinion n. 777 of 24 July 2025. The proponent must submit a request to start the compliance verification procedures within the terms indicated in that opinion. Article 3 – Environmental Conditions from Ministry of Culture The proponent must comply with environmental conditions in the Ministry of Culture note prot. n. 31042 of 18/11/2025. The proponent must submit a request to start the compliance verification procedures within the terms indicated in that opinion. Article 4 – Compliance Verification The Ministry of Environment and Energy Security – General Directorate for Environmental Assessments is the competent authority to verify compliance with the conditions in Articles 2 and 3. An Environmental Observatory will be established for the project, under the General Directorate for Environmental Assessments, funded by LNEnergy S.r.l., to ensure transparency and monitoring. The Observatory will include: Ministry of Environment (Chair) Ministry of Culture Abruzzo Region ARPA Abruzzo (Regional Environmental Protection Agency) Ministry of Infrastructure – Dams Directorate, for monitoring subsidence, pore pressure, and seismicity, with focus on the Diga di Bomba dam. Detailed rules for the Observatory will be issued by ministerial decree. Until the Observatory is fully established, the Ministry will verify compliance using designated offices and personnel, following specific procedures for reporting and timelines.

data.author: BMC77

data.author: itsawrap
data.content: Final part... Article 5 – Publication The decree is notified to: LNEnergy S.r.l. Ministry of Culture ARPA Abruzzo Municipalities of Bomba, Tornareccio, Pennadomo Abruzzo Region (for transmission to other authorities) The decree, together with the opinions from the PNRR-PNIEC Commission and Ministry of Culture, will be published on the Ministry of Environment and Energy Security website. Appeals: Judicial appeal to the TAR (Regional Administrative Court) within 60 days of notification. Alternatively, extraordinary appeal to the President of the Republic within 120 days. For parties not directly notified, appeal deadlines start from the date of publication on the Ministry website. Key Points in Plain English The project has received environmental compatibility approval with conditions. Approval is valid for 5 years, subject to renewal. Environmental compliance will be monitored by a multi-agency observatory. The project has landscape/heritage authorization from the Ministry of Culture. Legal remedies are allowed via administrative courts or presidential appeal.

data.content: Big Tech firms are requesting hundreds of gigawatts of power demand from data centers to connect to the U.S. grids. But aging grid infrastructure in key regional markets and grid investments lagging behind the soaring demand are forcing grid operators to offer some alternative options to the hyperscalers looking to hook up their proposed data centers to the grids. One is "bring your own generation"-a trend that's expected to rise in the coming years. In many areas, grid operators are telling Big Tech to plan their data centers together with a power source to serve the facility's electricity demand.

data.author: Buffin
data.content: "In this video, Stephen Williams, Co-CEO, outlines the company's differentiated portfolio approach to pre-cash flow energy assets, focusing on identifying opportunities that are mispriced and applying technical and commercial expertise to unlock value efficiently. Stephen covers how Reabold has successfully executed this strategy in the past, including the Victory gas project, where a modest initial investment was ultimately sold to Shell for £32 million. The team also explains its deliberate focus on European gas assets, highlighting the backdrop of declining indigenous supply alongside resilient demand across the region. The latter part of the discussion introduces West Newton, one of the largest onshore gas discoveries in the UK and Western Europe, with an estimated 200 bcf resource. Reabold sets out the investment case, the scale of the opportunity, and the range of exit options available, from a potential sale through to self-development, offering greater strategic optionality than previous projects." https://reabold.com/activity-updates/rvQage-business-overview

data.author: itsawrap
data.content: I dropped the decree into chatgpt for a translation... DECREE Project: SMALL SCALE LNG PLANT – Colle Santo Gas Field Proponent: LNEnergy S.r.l. Type: Environmental Compatibility Assessment (ECA) Article 1 – Environmental Compatibility Assessment Positive environmental compatibility is granted for the project “SMALL SCALE LNG PLANT – Colle Santo Gas Field” (onshore liquid and gaseous hydrocarbons), including: A favorable opinion regarding no significant negative impact on Natura 2000 sites, based on a Level II impact assessment. A favorable opinion on the Preliminary Plan for the use of excavated soil and rocks, as required by Article 24(3) of DPR 120/2017. These approvals are subject to compliance with environmental conditions set out in Articles 2 and 3. The decree includes landscape authorization under Article 146 of Legislative Decree 42/2004, as referenced in Article 25(2-quinquies) of Legislative Decree 152/2006, subject to the conditions 1 (1.1–1.4) and 2 in the Ministry of Culture opinion (prot. n. 31042, 18/11/2025). Validity: The decree is effective for five years from the date of publication on the Ministry of Environment and Energy Security website. After this period, a new environmental impact assessment must be carried out, unless an extension is requested. Article 2 – Environmental Conditions from PNRR-PNIEC Commission The proponent must comply with the environmental conditions in the PNRR-PNIEC Commission opinion n. 777 of 24 July 2025. The proponent must submit a request to start the compliance verification procedures within the terms indicated in that opinion. Article 3 – Environmental Conditions from Ministry of Culture The proponent must comply with environmental conditions in the Ministry of Culture note prot. n. 31042 of 18/11/2025. The proponent must submit a request to start the compliance verification procedures within the terms indicated in that opinion. Article 4 – Compliance Verification The Ministry of Environment and Energy Security – General Directorate for Environmental Assessments is the competent authority to verify compliance with the conditions in Articles 2 and 3. An Environmental Observatory will be established for the project, under the General Directorate for Environmental Assessments, funded by LNEnergy S.r.l., to ensure transparency and monitoring. The Observatory will include: Ministry of Environment (Chair) Ministry of Culture Abruzzo Region ARPA Abruzzo (Regional Environmental Protection Agency) Ministry of Infrastructure – Dams Directorate, for monitoring subsidence, pore pressure, and seismicity, with focus on the Diga di Bomba dam. Detailed rules for the Observatory will be issued by ministerial decree. Until the Observatory is fully established, the Ministry will verify compliance using designated offices and personnel, following specific procedures for reporting and timelines.

data.author: itsawrap
data.content: Final part... Article 5 – Publication The decree is notified to: LNEnergy S.r.l. Ministry of Culture ARPA Abruzzo Municipalities of Bomba, Tornareccio, Pennadomo Abruzzo Region (for transmission to other authorities) The decree, together with the opinions from the PNRR-PNIEC Commission and Ministry of Culture, will be published on the Ministry of Environment and Energy Security website. Appeals: Judicial appeal to the TAR (Regional Administrative Court) within 60 days of notification. Alternatively, extraordinary appeal to the President of the Republic within 120 days. For parties not directly notified, appeal deadlines start from the date of publication on the Ministry website. Key Points in Plain English The project has received environmental compatibility approval with conditions. Approval is valid for 5 years, subject to renewal. Environmental compliance will be monitored by a multi-agency observatory. The project has landscape/heritage authorization from the Ministry of Culture. Legal remedies are allowed via administrative courts or presidential appeal.

data.author: Laura2022
data.content: Big Tech firms are requesting hundreds of gigawatts of power demand from data centers to connect to the U.S. grids. But aging grid infrastructure in key regional markets and grid investments lagging behind the soaring demand are forcing grid operators to offer some alternative options to the hyperscalers looking to hook up their proposed data centers to the grids. One is "bring your own generation"-a trend that's expected to rise in the coming years. In many areas, grid operators are telling Big Tech to plan their data centers together with a power source to serve the facility's electricity demand.

data.content: Good morning all. Odins I read through some of the old RNS'S on Cali  and double checked the figures with AI (I love this new AI stuff) and we should be due back a fair bit of compensation . Daily Production: During late 2021, prior to the acquisition of the entity by Daybreak Oil and Gas in October 2021, Reabold California's production was reported at approximately 70 barrels of oil per day. Assets: Reabold California operated 10 producing wells in the Sacramento Basin with proved reserves of 613,000 barrels of oil equivalent. Based on Reabold Resources' interim report for the period ending June 30, 2020, the estimated cash operating cost for their California assets was approximately US$14.40 per barrel of oil equivalent (boe). Key details regarding Reabold's California production costs (circa 2019-2020): Operating Costs: The company reported an operating cost of roughly $13-$14 per boe. Production Volume: In the first half of 2020, they produced 36,991 gross boe (18,496 net). Revenue & Pricing: During the same H1 2020 period, they generated US$38.1 per boe in revenue ($30.5 net of royalties). Impact of Shut-ins: Reports indicated that if a wastewater well had been successfully drilled before operational pauses, the production costs could have been sustained at lower levels, potentially around $13-$14 per barrel.

Daily Production: During late 2021, prior to the acquisition of the entity by Daybreak Oil and Gas in October 2021, Reabold California's production was reported at approximately 70 barrels of oil per day. data.author: MediMan
data.content: I think its great to be cautious of rampers, as it is de-rampers, but do you know who I'm most cautious of ..... people that come onto boards warning and offering caution and seeding doubt. Now let's look at this from a couple of angles. A person could have a heart of gold, a genuine white Knight that is desperate to help people. Or they could be acting out of the regret of a recent decision and / or wanting to get back in cheaper. It would be impossible to know from guesswork, from which a person's motives lay. But when offered clues that they sold about before a recent huge rise, you begin to piece together such clues. It doesn't matter what people say on boards, make your own investment decisions based on your own research. ...beware the de-rampers, they will lose you money.

data.content: Morning all, these are two excerpts from the UJO update today regarding W.N . West Newton Development (PEDL183 - 16.665% interest) West Newton is situated onshore UK, north of the River Humber, encompassing the town of Beverley, East Yorkshire.  The licence area is within the western sector of the Southern Zechstein Basin. The West Newton drilling programmes have yielded substantial hydrocarbon discoveries within the Kirkham Abbey formation and an independent resource assessment by RPC indicates the presence of a contingent resource of 198 billion cubic feet of gas. The Company`s technical team has further identified targets within the licence area which indicate volumetrically significant prospective gas resources in an untested formation. The operator, Rathlin Energy (UK) Ltd ("Rathlin") has an ambitious work programme planned for this project during 2026, subject to receipt of regulatory consents. David Bramhill, Executive Chairman of Union Jack, commented: "Union Jack holds numerous valuable assets on both sides of the Atlantic. "The potential revenues from an expansion at Wressle and a development at West Newton are expected to be material to the Company.  I have no doubt that the current attitude towards fossil fuels will change for the better in the UK and it is a waiting game for the significant commercial and strategic costs of the energy transition to become evident compared to the many merits of maintaining and encouraging domestic oil and gas production.

Daily Production: During late 2021, prior to the acquisition of the entity by Daybreak Oil and Gas in October 2021, Reabold California's production was reported at approximately 70 barrels of oil per day. data.author: j1osf
data.content: Until around 10 years ago, Great Britain was mostly self-sufficient in gas and received natural gas from the North and Irish Sea.  Now the UK gets its gas from its own North Sea fields (about a third), but relies heavily on imports, primarily from Norway via pipelines. Why are we importing the stuff when we still have our own reserves. It's there waiting to be extracted. Not extracting it is not for the good of the UK or for global warming, in my opinion is for the good of powers that be lining their own pockets. Disagree with me if you want, but that is my opinion.

data.author: DAVID.M
data.content: Odins, it's more likely to be the result of a generally poor market. The very sharp fall in gold and silver, although no directly related, seems to have spooked investors in the smaller stocks. Stephen Williams hasn't helped with his recent party political broadcast. He seems to think that their business model is working with just one completed transaction in eight years, and that one at a valuation well below what the market was expecting. It doesn't help that Colle Santo, which they describe as a good deal, just kicks the repayment can from Beacon well down the road, and without any certainty of getting the sort of return expected. Beacon itself should have completed part of the deal in November, but haven't yet produced the prospectus for the deal and attached fund raise. It doesn't seem such a great deal selling to a cash shell, with no other business, and having to fund part of the deal yourself, even if you get shares of unknown future value. The only bright spot is the recent purchase by Rohan Oza. I originally though that it might lead to something interesting, but that excitement has died down, and we will have to wait and see. If things have to rely on delivery by Stephen Williams and Sachin Oza, then we are all doomed.

data.author: Simon64
data.content: Morning all, these are two excerpts from the UJO update today regarding W.N . West Newton Development (PEDL183 - 16.665% interest) West Newton is situated onshore UK, north of the River Humber, encompassing the town of Beverley, East Yorkshire.  The licence area is within the western sector of the Southern Zechstein Basin. The West Newton drilling programmes have yielded substantial hydrocarbon discoveries within the Kirkham Abbey formation and an independent resource assessment by RPC indicates the presence of a contingent resource of 198 billion cubic feet of gas. The Company`s technical team has further identified targets within the licence area which indicate volumetrically significant prospective gas resources in an untested formation. The operator, Rathlin Energy (UK) Ltd ("Rathlin") has an ambitious work programme planned for this project during 2026, subject to receipt of regulatory consents. David Bramhill, Executive Chairman of Union Jack, commented: "Union Jack holds numerous valuable assets on both sides of the Atlantic. "The potential revenues from an expansion at Wressle and a development at West Newton are expected to be material to the Company.  I have no doubt that the current attitude towards fossil fuels will change for the better in the UK and it is a waiting game for the significant commercial and strategic costs of the energy transition to become evident compared to the many merits of maintaining and encouraging domestic oil and gas production.

data.author: Simon64
data.content: Good morning all. Odins I read through some of the old RNS'S on Cali  and double checked the figures with AI (I love this new AI stuff) and we should be due back a fair bit of compensation . Daily Production: During late 2021, prior to the acquisition of the entity by Daybreak Oil and Gas in October 2021, Reabold California's production was reported at approximately 70 barrels of oil per day. Assets: Reabold California operated 10 producing wells in the Sacramento Basin with proved reserves of 613,000 barrels of oil equivalent. Based on Reabold Resources' interim report for the period ending June 30, 2020, the estimated cash operating cost for their California assets was approximately US$14.40 per barrel of oil equivalent (boe). Key details regarding Reabold's California production costs (circa 2019-2020): Operating Costs: The company reported an operating cost of roughly $13-$14 per boe. Production Volume: In the first half of 2020, they produced 36,991 gross boe (18,496 net). Revenue & Pricing: During the same H1 2020 period, they generated US$38.1 per boe in revenue ($30.5 net of royalties). Impact of Shut-ins: Reports indicated that if a wastewater well had been successfully drilled before operational pauses, the production costs could have been sustained at lower levels, potentially around $13-$14 per barrel.

data.content: Until around 10 years ago, Great Britain was mostly self-sufficient in gas and received natural gas from the North and Irish Sea. Not extracting it is not for the good of the UK or for global warming, in my opinion is for the good of powers that be lining their own pockets. Disagree with me if you want, but that is my opinion.

data.author: DAVID.M
data.content: Odins, it's more likely to be the result of a generally poor market. The very sharp fall in gold and silver, although no directly related, seems to have spooked investors in the smaller stocks. Stephen Williams hasn't helped with his recent party political broadcast. He seems to think that their business model is working with just one completed transaction in eight years, and that one at a valuation well below what the market was expecting. It doesn't help that Colle Santo, which they describe as a good deal, just kicks the repayment can from Beacon well down the road, and without any certainty of getting the sort of return expected. Beacon itself should have completed part of the deal in November, but haven't yet produced the prospectus for the deal and attached fund raise. It doesn't seem such a great deal selling to a cash shell, with no other business, and having to fund part of the deal yourself, even if you get shares of unknown future value. The only bright spot is the recent purchase by Rohan Oza. I originally though that it might lead to something interesting, but that excitement has died down, and we will have to wait and see. If things have to rely on delivery by Stephen Williams and Sachin Oza, then we are all doomed.

data.author: Simon64
data.content: Morning all, these are two excerpts from the UJO update today regarding W.N . West Newton Development (PEDL183 - 16.665% interest) West Newton is situated onshore UK, north of the River Humber, encompassing the town of Beverley, East Yorkshire.  The licence area is within the western sector of the Southern Zechstein Basin. The West Newton drilling programmes have yielded substantial hydrocarbon discoveries within the Kirkham Abbey formation and an independent resource assessment by RPC indicates the presence of a contingent resource of 198 billion cubic feet of gas. The Company`s technical team has further identified targets within the licence area which indicate volumetrically significant prospective gas resources in an untested formation. The operator, Rathlin Energy (UK) Ltd ("Rathlin") has an ambitious work programme planned for this project during 2026, subject to receipt of regulatory consents. David Bramhill, Executive Chairman of Union Jack, commented: "Union Jack holds numerous valuable assets on both sides of the Atlantic. "The potential revenues from an expansion at Wressle and a development at West Newton are expected to be material to the Company.  I have no doubt that the current attitude towards fossil fuels will change for the better in the UK and it is a waiting game for the significant commercial and strategic costs of the energy transition to become evident compared to the many merits of maintaining and encouraging domestic oil and gas production.

data.author: Simon64
data.content: Good morning all. Odins I read through some of the old RNS'S on Cali  and double checked the figures with AI (I love this new AI stuff) and we should be due back a fair bit of compensation . Daily Production: During late 2021, prior to the acquisition of the entity by Daybreak Oil and Gas in October 2021, Reabold California's production was reported at approximately 70 barrels of oil per day. Assets: Reabold California operated 10 producing wells in the Sacramento Basin with proved reserves of 613,000 barrels of oil equivalent. Based on Reabold Resources' interim report for the period ending June 30, 2020, the estimated cash operating cost for their California assets was approximately US$14.40 per barrel of oil equivalent (boe). Key details regarding Reabold's California production costs (circa 2019-2020): Operating Costs: The company reported an operating cost of roughly $13-$14 per boe. Production Volume: In the first half of 2020, they produced 36,991 gross boe (18,496 net). Revenue & Pricing: During the same H1 2020 period, they generated US$38.1 per boe in revenue ($30.5 net of royalties). Impact of Shut-ins: Reports indicated that if a wastewater well had been successfully drilled before operational pauses, the production costs could have been sustained at lower levels, potentially around $13-$14 per barrel.

data.author: j1osf
data.content: Until around 10 years ago, Great Britain was mostly self-sufficient in gas and received natural gas from the North and Irish Sea.  Now the UK gets its gas from its own North Sea fields (about a third), but relies heavily on imports, primarily from Norway via pipelines. Why are we importing the stuff when we still have our own reserves. It's there waiting to be extracted. Not extracting it is not for the good of the UK or for global warming, in my opinion is for the good of powers that be lining their own pockets. Disagree with me if you want, but that is my opinion.

data.author: DAVID.M
data.content: Odins, it's more likely to be the result of a generally poor market. The very sharp fall in gold and silver, although no directly related, seems to have spooked investors in the smaller stocks. Stephen Williams hasn't helped with his recent party political broadcast. He seems to think that their business model is working with just one completed transaction in eight years, and that one at a valuation well below what the market was expecting. It doesn't help that Colle Santo, which they describe as a good deal, just kicks the repayment can from Beacon well down the road, and without any certainty of getting the sort of return expected. Beacon itself should have completed part of the deal in November, but haven't yet produced the prospectus for the deal and attached fund raise. It doesn't seem such a great deal selling to a cash shell, with no other business, and having to fund part of the deal yourself, even if you get shares of unknown future value. The only bright spot is the recent purchase by Rohan Oza. I originally though that it might lead to something interesting, but that excitement has died down, and we will have to wait and see. If things have to rely on delivery by Stephen Williams and Sachin Oza, then we are all doomed.

data.author: Simon64
data.content: Morning all, these are two excerpts from the UJO update today regarding W.N . West Newton Development (PEDL183 - 16.665% interest) West Newton is situated onshore UK, north of the River Humber, encompassing the town of Beverley, East Yorkshire.  The licence area is within the western sector of the Southern Zechstein Basin. The West Newton drilling programmes have yielded substantial hydrocarbon discoveries within the Kirkham Abbey formation and an independent resource assessment by RPC indicates the presence of a contingent resource of 198 billion cubic feet of gas. The Company`s technical team has further identified targets within the licence area which indicate volumetrically significant prospective gas resources in an untested formation. The operator, Rathlin Energy (UK) Ltd ("Rathlin") has an ambitious work programme planned for this project during 2026, subject to receipt of regulatory consents. David Bramhill, Executive Chairman of Union Jack, commented: "Union Jack holds numerous valuable assets on both sides of the Atlantic. "The potential revenues from an expansion at Wressle and a development at West Newton are expected to be material to the Company.  I have no doubt that the current attitude towards fossil fuels will change for the better in the UK and it is a waiting game for the significant commercial and strategic costs of the energy transition to become evident compared to the many merits of maintaining and encouraging domestic oil and gas production.

data.author: Simon64
data.content: Good morning all. Odins I read through some of the old RNS'S on Cali  and double checked the figures with AI (I love this new AI stuff) and we should be due back a fair bit of compensation . Daily Production: During late 2021, prior to the acquisition of the entity by Daybreak Oil and Gas in October 2021, Reabold California's production was reported at approximately 70 barrels of oil per day. Assets: Reabold California operated 10 producing wells in the Sacramento Basin with proved reserves of 613,000 barrels of oil equivalent. Based on Reabold Resources' interim report for the period ending June 30, 2020, the estimated cash operating cost for their California assets was approximately US$14.40 per barrel of oil equivalent (boe). Key details regarding Reabold's California production costs (circa 2019-2020): Operating Costs: The company reported an operating cost of roughly $13-$14 per boe. Production Volume: In the first half of 2020, they produced 36,991 gross boe (18,496 net). Revenue & Pricing: During the same H1 2020 period, they generated US$38.1 per boe in revenue ($30.5 net of royalties). Impact of Shut-ins: Reports indicated that if a wastewater well had been successfully drilled before operational pauses, the production costs could have been sustained at lower levels, potentially around $13-$14 per barrel.

data.author: MediMan
data.content: I think its great to be cautious of rampers, as it is de-rampers, but do you know who I'm most cautious of ..... people that come onto boards warning and offering caution and seeding doubt. Now let's look at this from a couple of angles. A person could have a heart of gold, a genuine white Knight that is desperate to help people. Or they could be acting out of the regret of a recent decision and / or wanting to get back in cheaper. It would be impossible to know from guesswork, from which a person's motives lay. But when offered clues that they sold about before a recent huge rise, you begin to piece together such clues. It doesn't matter what people say on boards, make your own investment decisions based on your own research. ...beware the de-rampers, they will lose you money.

data.content: I was invested in RBD for years - finally sold out in Q4 before the spike unfortunately. Here's my take on WN - the EA consultation ended 06.10.25 - imo a decision will be announced in Q1 2026 - the NSTA deadline for re-entering is 30.06.26 If the permit is refused the sp will collapse If the permit is granted, a legal challenge will be launched immediately - the sp will fall sharply as a Judicial Review will take many months - well past the NSTA deadline I suspect a placing will happen soon, probably before the decision. they need to refill the coffers if only to maintain the gravy train for a few more years Finally, simon's LSE post "Don't forget the final C.S approval approx 16 million euro's heading our way over the next couple of years." is complete bollux, he clearly doesnt understand the mechanics of the deal ...beware the rampers, they will lose you money
